text: Q#24 | wmultiple Choice Type | Award: 1 | Penalty: 0.3333 | Set Theory & Algebra Let p, g be distinct primes. If J is a proper subgroup of (Z, +) containing exactly three of {p, p + ¢, pq, p?, ¢*} , which three elements does J include? A A{p,p + q,pq} B. {pq,p?, ¢*} c. {p,pq,p*} D. {p,pq,q"} Your Answer: Correct Answer: C
